bibl.note: This is a letter dated December 23, 1812 from Colonel Jas.Winston to John Sevier. He informs Sevier of the status of his memorial, and its introduction into the legislation of the state of Tennessee.

div.p:
I hereby acknowledge with pleasure the receipt of your favour favor dated 30th ultimo at Washington City- I am at all times ready to obey the calls of friendship & acquaintance and particularly so when coming from yourself- your memorial was introduced by myself into the legislation of this State- although the subject had been dormant for a long time, yet it was not possible for one of that nature to be entirely forgotton forgotten - The enclosed resolution will fully inform you the steps taken by our Legislature upon your memorial- It seems that you were mistaken as to the pair of pistols a second only being ordered to be presented- I know you will recieve receive
only this with equal satisfaction at it goes to testify
the same service performed by you, and the same gratitude felt by your countrymen as if both had been presented-
div.closer:
I am Dr Dear Sir your most obt obedient
Hble Humble
Sert Servant . PS. Present my most respectful complements to Gov Governor . Shelby-Inform him I received his polite favour just before I left home, but owing now to a purpose of business I cannot answer it_
J. Winston The Hol Honorable . John Sevier
The Honourable Honorable
John Sevier City of Washington
Colonel Jas. Winston with
No North . Carolina
